abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the project is to
            expand domestic nitrogenous fertilizer capacity through the
            construction of a fertilizer plant at Vijaipur in the State
            of Madhya Pradesh using natural gas as feedstock. The plant
            will have a daily capacity of about 1,350 metric tons of
            ammonia and about 2,200 tons of urea. The project also
            includes the provision of infrastructure and auxiliary and
            offsite facilities required for the efficient operation of
            the plant. Possible risk facing the project include
            implementation delays and start-up and production
            stabilization difficulties. These risks are mitigated by the
            use of commercially proven technologies supplied by
            internationally recognized engineering firms who have
            experience in executing similar projects in India. The loan
            will also support a study to rehabilitate two coal-based
            fertilizer plants at Talcher and Ranagundam, owned by the
            Fertilizer Corporation of India.
